Var.Name: SYSLOCALLEDS
Var.Descr:
Local Leds Status. sysLocalLeds[0] = Green led sysLocalLeds[1] = Red led sysLocalLeds[2] = Yellow led
0 = Led Off. 1 = Led On. 2 = Led Blink.

Var.Name: SYSBACKLIGHT
Var.Descr: Backlight Status. 0 = Off. 1 = On. 2 = Blink. 3 = Timed. 4 = Timed running.

Var.Name: SYSCLOCK
Var.Descr: System Date and Time Read. It is a structure of type TypeDataTime composed by the following fields: seconds : USINT; seconds [0...59] minutes : USINT; minutes [0...59] hours : USINT; hours [0...23] dayweek : USINT; day of week [0...6] daymonth : USINT; day of month [1...31] month : USINT; month [1...12] year : USINT; year [10...99]

Var.Name: SYSIMPULSECOUNTER
Var.Descr: System Impulse Counter Input 1 (read). It is a structure of type STRUCTIMPULSECOUNTER composed by the following fields: counter : UDINT; number of input commutation from close to open frequency : UDINT; frequency [Hz/10]

Var.Name: SYSIMPULSECOUNTER_AS_FDI
Var.Descr: System Impulse Counter 1 as Digital Input

Var.Name: SYSIMPULSECOUNTER_RESETCOUNTER
Var.Descr: Reset sysImpulseCounter.counter of System Impulse Counter Input 1

Var.Name: SYSIMPULSECOUNTER2
Var.Descr: System Impulse Counter Input 2 (read). It is a structure of type STRUCTIMPULSECOUNTER composed by the following fields: counter : UDINT; number of input commutation from close to open frequency : UDINT; frequency [Hz/10]

Var.Name: SYSIMPULSECOUNTER_AS_FDI2
Var.Descr: System Impulse Counter 2 as Digital Input

Var.Name: SYSIMPULSECOUNTER_RESETCOUNTER2
Var.Descr: Reset sysImpulseCounter.counter of System Impulse Counter Input 2

Var.Name: SYSPERIPHERALSTATUS
Var.Descr: Peripheral status. It is an array of BOOL used to check connection status of expansions over field CANopen. Every expansion has its own CANopen serial address. Connection status of expansion having serial address 3 is sysPeripheralStatus[5]. Connection status of expansion having serial address 10 is sysPeripheralStatus[12]. TRUE = means expansion not recognized. FALSE = expansion correctly connected.

Var.Name: SYSCANOPENNODESTATUS
Var.Descr: CANopen Node Status. It is an array of USINT used to check NMT status of expansions over field CANopen. Every expansion has its own CANopen serial address. Connection status of expansion having serial address 3 is sysCANopenNodeStatus [5]. Connection status of expansion having serial address 10 is sysCANopenNodeStatus [12]. 0 = NMT BOOTUP/NOTKNOWN 1 = NMT MISSING 4 = NMT STOPPED 5 = NMT OPERATIONAL 6 = NMT RESET 7 = NMT RESET COMM 127 = NMT PRE OPERATIONAL

Var.Name: SYSMBMRTUNODESTATUS
Var.Descr:
System Modbus Master RTU communication status. It is a structure of type MBMNODESTATUS composed by the following fields: com_hdlr : BYTE; Communication handler addr_1 : USINT; Network address part 1 addr_2 : USINT; Network address part 2 addr_3 : USINT; Network address part 3 addr_4 : USINT; Network address part 4 cfg : BOOL; Configurated pres : BOOL; Present miss : BOOL; Slave failure missCnt: UINT; Number of Task Timed cycles with Slave failure state : UINT;Slave failure error code
state could have the following meanings: (valid only if miss is TRUE, never set to 0 ) 0 = No errors 1 = Tx data failed 2 = Rx time out (at starting ) 3 = System error 4 = Rx time out (frame not ended)

Var.Name: SYSMBMRTUNODEACT
Var.Descr: System Modbus Master RTU Actual pointed node index

Var.Name: SYSMBMTCPNODEACT
Var.Descr: System Modbus Master TCP Actual pointed node index

Var.Name: SYSMBMRTUNODEDISABLEWRITES
Var.Descr: System Modbus Master RTU Disable any Write command for the node

Var.Name: SYSMBMTCPNODEDISABLEWRITES
Var.Descr: System Modbus Master TCP Disable any Write command for the node

Var.Name: SYSMBMTCPNODESTATUS
Var.Descr:
System Modbus Master TCP communication status. It is a structure of type MBMNODESTATUS composed by the following fields: com_hdlr : BYTE; Communication handler addr_1 : USINT; Network address part 1 addr_2 : USINT; Network address part 2 addr_3 : USINT; Network address part 3 addr_4 : USINT; Network address part 4 cfg : BOOL; Configurated pres : BOOL; Present miss : BOOL; Slave failure missCnt: UINT; Number of Task Timed cycles with Slave failure state : UINT;Slave failure error code
state could have the following meanings: (valid only if miss is TRUE, never set to 0 ) 0 = No errors 1 = Tx data failed 2 = Rx time out (at starting ) 3 = System error 4 = Rx time out (frame not ended)

Var.Name: SYSMBMRTUNODEPRESENCE
Var.Descr: System Modbus Master RTU node presence: TRUE = present, FALSE = off line If sysMbMRtuNodePresence[i] is set to FALSE then sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].cfg keep it's value sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].pres is set to FALSE sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].miss is set to FALSE sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].missCnt is set to 0 sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].state is set to 0 (No error) If sysMbMRtuNodePresence[i] is set to TRUE then sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].cfg keep it's value sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].pres is up to date sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].miss is up to date sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].missCnt is up to date sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].state is up to date

Var.Name: SYSMBMTCPNODEPRESENCE
Var.Descr: System Modbus Master TCP node presence: TRUE = present, FALSE = off line If sysMbMTcpNodePresence[i] is set to FALSE then sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].cfg keep it's value sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].pres is set to FALSE sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].miss is set to FALSE sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].missCnt is set to 0 sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].state is set to 0 (No error) If sysMbMTcpNodePresence[i] is set to TRUE then sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].cfg keep it's value sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].pres is up to date sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].miss is up to date sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].missCnt is up to date sysMbMTcpNodeStatus[i].state is up to date

Var.Name: SYSUSBCOMMAND
Var.Descr:
System command to upload/download to/from USB-Host If the value of sysUsbCommand is in the table below, then the file is saved/loaded where indicated by the corresponding parameter. If the value is sysUsbCommand has an offset of 100 the file will saved/loaded in NOR flash. If it has an offset of 200, it will be saved/loaded in the microSD. Offset 100-200 is not supported by all commands.
Table: 0 = No command 7 = load PARAM.BIN from USBH 8 = load PLCIEC.COD from USBH to PLC_volume 9 = load HMIIEC.COD from USBH to HMI_volume 10 = load PARAM.DAT or PARAM.RAW from USBH 11 = save PARAM.DAT to USBH 12 = load CONNEC.PAR from USBH to PAR_volume 13 = load HMIREM.KBD from USBH to REM_volume 14 = save sysUsbFileName file from microSD to USBH, file name can be name.ext or *.ext 15 = load sysUsbFileName file from USBH to DAT_volume (ext=DAT) otherwise to microSD, file name can be name.ext or *.ext 16 = load file sysUsbFileName from DAT_volume, file must have PARAM.DAT format and filename name.DAT or name .RAW 18 = load BACNET.DAT from USBH to DAT_volume 19 = save PARAM.BIN to USBH 20 = save LON.XIF to NOR flash 21 = save LON.XIF to USBH
108 = load PLCIEC.COD from USBH to NOR flash 109 = load HMIIEC.COD from USBH to NOR flash 112 = load CONNEC.PAR from USBH to NOR flash 113 = load HMIREM.KBD from USBH to NOR flash 114 = save sysUsbFileName file from NOR flash to USBH, file name can be name.ext or *.ext 115 = load sysUsbFileName file from USBH, file name can be name.ext or *.ext, to NOR flash 116 = load file sysUsbFileName from NOR flash, file must have PARAM.DAT format and filename name.DAT or name .RAW 118 = load BACNET.DAT from USBH to NOR flash
208 = load PLCIEC.COD from USBH to microSD 209 = load HMIIEC.COD from USBH to microSD 212 = load CONNEC.PAR from USBH to microSD 213 = load HMIREM.KBD from USBH to microSD 214 = save sysUsbFileName file from microSD to USBH, file name can be name.ext or *.ext 215 = load sysUsbFileName file from USBH, file name can be name.ext or *.ext, to microSD 216 = load file sysUsbFileName from microSD, file must have PARAM.DAT format and filename name.DAT or name .RAW 218 = load BACNET.DAT from USBH to microSD
Note: PLC_volume = volume per PLCIEC.COD HMI_volume = volume per HMIIEC.COD PAR_volume = volume per CONNEC.PAR REM_volume = volume per HMIREM.KBD DAT_volume = volume per BACNET.DAT

Var.Name: SYSUSBSTATUS
Var.Descr: System status of operation on USB-Host 0 = command completed 1 = command processing 255 = command failed 254 = file not present 253 = file too long 252 = USBH not connected 251 = file not compatible 250 = some parameters fails 249 = write file failed 248 = open file in write failed

VarExt.Name: SYSMBMRTUNODEPRESENCE
VarExt.Descr: System Modbus Master RTU node presence: TRUE = present, FALSE = off line If sysMbMRtuNodePresence[i] is set to FALSE then sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].cfg keep it's value sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].pres is set to FALSE sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].miss is set to FALSE sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].missCnt is set to 0 sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].state is set to 0 (No error) If sysMbMRtuNodePresence[i] is set to TRUE then sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].cfg keep it's value sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].pres is up to date sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].miss is up to date sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].missCnt is up to date sysMbMRtuNodeStatus[i].state is up to date

VarExt.Name: SYSMBMRTUNODESTATUS
VarExt.Descr:
System Modbus Master RTU communication status. It is a structure of type MBMNODESTATUS composed by the following fields: com_hdlr : BYTE; Communication handler addr_1 : USINT; Network address part 1 addr_2 : USINT; Network address part 2 addr_3 : USINT; Network address part 3 addr_4 : USINT; Network address part 4 cfg : BOOL; Configurated pres : BOOL; Present miss : BOOL; Slave failure missCnt: UINT; Number of Task Timed cycles with Slave failure state : UINT;Slave failure error code
state could have the following meanings: (valid only if miss is TRUE, never set to 0 ) 0 = No errors 1 = Tx data failed 2 = Rx time out (at starting ) 3 = System error 4 = Rx time out (frame not ended)
